sub_title: Process Manager at Danone Nutricia | Cum laude graduate European Masters in Food Studies (EMFS) | Finalist of Global Unilever Future Leader League
summary:
“You outperformed yourself once again, Chau” – my supervisor Tadhg O’Sullivan said to me after my graduation defense that finalized my internship at Heineken Netherlands. 

At the age of 19, I made a bold decision to move to the Netherlands all by myself to follow my dream of becoming food product developer. I started my journey with Process and Food Technology (PFT) at The Hague University of Applied Sciences. My first year was extremely challenging to the point where I wanted to give up and move back to Viet Nam. My performance at school was not very positive and the experience of living alone for the first time brought me both mental and physical struggles. The main thing, besides family, kept me going was my dream.

Being a result-oriented and disciplined person, I kept pushing my limit to grow both professionally and personally. In my fourth year, I got accepted in Global Innovation and Research department of Heineken for my graduation internship. Given such creative topics with endless support from Heineken, I graduated my Bachelor of Science with distinction. It was hard work paid off! 

My time at Heineken also reconfirmed my strong passion for food technology and product development. In order to prepare myself for the future career, I am participating in European Master in Food Studies in Wageningen University & Research. The master program will take place in four countries: Netherlands, Ireland, Sweden and France with the cooperation of 9 food industry partners. 

A new journey is ahead of me with lots of challenges as well as opportunities. More importanly, this ride will be full of excitement and joy which I would like to share with you. Let’s connect and share our beautiful journey together!

✉ nguyenchau1831@gmail.com
✆ 06 16044592

Key Competencies
•	Organic Chemistry
•	Biotechnology
•	Food Chemistry
•	Food Safety
•      Dairy production
•  	Sensory Evaluation
•	Drying
•	Brewery

Professional interests
•	Food Product Development
•	Food Production Process

projects.title: Fused Deposition Method (3D) printed honeycomb from polylactic acid
projects.description:
Achievements:
•	Theoretically modified the properties of bio polylactic acid (PLA) for the sustainable production of a 3D printing honeycomb
•	Obtained samples of 3D-printed honeycomb from PLA on lab scale
Responsibilities:
•	Literature research on the characteristics of PLA and different modification methods
•	Designed the production process including biopolymer synthesis to 3D printing
•	Estimated the production cost
•	Discussed ethics aspects of 3D printed honeycomb and end of life treatment

contributors.headline: Process Manager at Danone Nutricia | Cum laude graduate European Masters in Food Studies (EMFS) | Finalist of Global Unilever Future Leader League

projects.title: Biogas Production from Glycerin Wastewater (assigned by Croda, B.V.)
projects.description:
•	Key question: “How can the process parameters be exploited in order to stabilize the production yield of biogas from glycerine wastewater in an economic and sustainable manner?”
•	Introduce alternative approaches for glycerine treatment, including anaerobic digestion.
•	Illustrate the anaerobic digestion process on Visio, focusing on the reactor type and process control.
•	Study of glycerine wastewater composition to identify required nutrition for microorganism.
•	Assess the thermodynamic and mass transfer phenomena aspects of the digestion.
•	Conduct a feasibility study

contributors.headline: Process Manager at Danone Nutricia | Cum laude graduate European Masters in Food Studies (EMFS) | Finalist of Global Unilever Future Leader League

projects.title: Utilisation of Brewer’s Spent Grains in Bread Making
projects.description:
•	Key question: What is the optimal amount of Brewer’s Spent Grain (BSG) that can be used as a partial replacement for wheat flour to industrially produce sensorial acceptable bread?
•	Literature researched on different amount of BSG in bread and its effect on general flavor
•	Performed two kitchen trials to prepare BSG bread and conducted a Consumer Acceptability Evaluation
•	Designed an industrial bakery with specialized equipment based on the recipe and procedure tested in the kitchen
•	Achieved an ideal BSG bread recipe which contains a great amount of high-value nutrition and meet the acceptance of customers.

contributors.headline: Process Manager at Danone Nutricia | Cum laude graduate European Masters in Food Studies (EMFS) | Finalist of Global Unilever Future Leader League

projects.title: Qualitative and Quantitative Risk Assessment of a Biodiesel Plant (assigned by Tebodin, B.V.)
projects.description:
•	Aim: Design a safe Biodiesel production plant by conducting Risk Management.
•	Established a Process Flow Diagram with detailed process control for each step of the production line.
•	Studied of Hazard & Operability (HAZOP) on a given P&ID. 
•	Accomplished a secure plot plan with minimal effect of possible accident scenarios using Safeti software.
•	Identified related chemical hazards and formulated prevention and mitigation measures.

contributors.headline: Process Manager at Danone Nutricia | Cum laude graduate European Masters in Food Studies (EMFS) | Finalist of Global Unilever Future Leader League

projects.title: Beer Brewing (cooperated with Crooked Spider and Bavaria, B.V.)
projects.description:
•	Conceptualized the beer production on industrial scale
•	Analyzed variables which influence the quality of beer
•	Brewed Blonde d'été beer on laboratory scale and obtained a pleasant citrus beer flavor with 4.9% alcohol content.
•	Reviewed on alcohol manufacturing and consumption legislations in Netherlands and Europe.
Designed label for Blonde d'été beer and created a beer commercial for marketing.

contributors.headline: Process Manager at Danone Nutricia | Cum laude graduate European Masters in Food Studies (EMFS) | Finalist of Global Unilever Future Leader League

projects.title: Titanium Dioxide Synthesis (assigned by Tronox Pigment Holland, B.V.)
projects.description:
•	Key question: What is the optimal process to synthesize Titanium dioxide used as white pigments?
•	Compared the two common process to synthesize TiO2 in order to choose the optimal approach.
•	Literature researched on key properties of TiO2 pigment
•	Conducted synthesis experiment with selected sol-gel method (using Tetra Isopropyl Titanate (TIPT) and methanol)
•	Estimated the energy cost of the plant annually
•	Successfully attained highly pure TiO2 with relatively optimal particle size and monochrome line.
•	Evaluated the safety and environmental concerns, focusing on emission and waste streams.

contributors.headline: Process Manager at Danone Nutricia | Cum laude graduate European Masters in Food Studies (EMFS) | Finalist of Global Unilever Future Leader League

projects.title: From Milk to Cheese (cooperated with Campina)
projects.description:
•	Designed an industrial cheese making process, including a Process Flow Diagram.
•	Studied the characteristics of Gouda cheese and variables that affect the cheese quality and optimal yield.
•	Applied HACCP, including monitoring procedures, corrective actions, verification procedures and record system.
•	Estimated the total investment cost
•	Prepared cheese from 10L of milk on laboratory scale and obtained 1kg of Gouda cheese.
•	Conduct the mass balance for final products and involved components.

contributors.headline: Process Manager at Danone Nutricia | Cum laude graduate European Masters in Food Studies (EMFS) | Finalist of Global Unilever Future Leader League

projects.title: Water Treatment (cooperated with Dunea)
projects.description:
•	Designed an industrial water treatment plant focusing on sand filtration.
•	Reviewed and compared standards of drinking water in the Netherlands and in Europe.
•	Estimated the total investment cost.
•	Performed a laboratory set-up for water purification.

profile_positions.description:
•	Global Food Processing department
•	Built equipment and developed process for mayonnaise production on lab scale
•      Developed a scale up model for mayonnaise production from la b to factory scale
•      Coded the model into Unilever internal software using Python
•      Pioneered data acquisition and cloud storage in recording trials on pilot plant
•      Grade: 9/10
profile_positions.title: Process Development Intern

profile_positions.description:
•	Global Innovation and Research department.
•	Project: Reduction of worty flavor in alcohol-free beer using lactic acid bacteria
•	Established the mechanism for the ability to reduce worty flavor of lactic acid bacteria strains.
•	Developed lactic acid bacteria integration methods on both lab scale and pilot scale.
•	Developed methods were practical with minimum disturbance to the current production process with effective worty flavor removal.
•	Performed sensory analysis which confirmed the reduction in worty flavor.
•	Supported other projects in studying other methods to improve alcohol-free beer flavor.
•	The result from thesis is considered to be patterned and is further investigated.
•	Final grade: 9.1
profile_positions.title: Product Development Intern

profile_positions.description:
•	Photovoltaics (PV) Modules and Applications department 
•	Developed a 1-minute temperature control method for solar panel production line
•	Enhanced the efficiency of quality control for solar panel production process by 150 times
•       Final grade: 9/10
•	Initiated the use of shape memory behavior of polymer for in-line temperature control
profile_positions.title: Research And Development Intern

skills: Hazard Analysis and Critical Control Points (HACCP)
